intro: Ageratina isolepis, commonly known as the velvetleaf ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and small, clustered white or pale blue flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Ageratina isolepis is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the genus Ageratina.
